meanings.definition: The state or condition of being imminent.
meanings.sent1: The imminencies of the storm made everyone seek shelter.
meanings.sent2: The imminencies of the deadline motivated him to work harder.
meanings.sent3: The imminencies of the party had everyone excited to attend.
meanings.sent4: The imminencies of the volcano eruption were felt throughout the town.
meanings.sent5: The imminencies of the train's arrival were signaled by the loud horn.

meanings.definition: The quality of being about to happen.
meanings.sent1: The imminencies of the concert brought joy to the audience.
meanings.sent2: The imminencies of the exam caused some anxiety among the students.
meanings.sent3: The imminencies of the surprise party were hard to keep secret.
meanings.sent4: The imminencies of the sunrise painted the sky in beautiful colors.
meanings.sent5: The imminencies of the new year filled the air with anticipation.
